meanings.definition: A confusing and difficult problem or question.
meanings.sent1: The math conundrum left the students scratching their heads.
meanings.sent2: Solving the conundrum of the missing keys took hours.
meanings.sent3: The conundrum of choosing between ice cream flavors was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her conundrum of whether to study or watch TV was like walking a tightrope.
meanings.sent5: The conundrum of the locked door haunted him all night.

meanings.definition: A riddle or puzzle, especially one that is challenging to solve.
meanings.sent1: The ancient conundrum stumped even the wisest of philosophers.
meanings.sent2: Solving the conundrum of the Sphinx required both wit and courage.
meanings.sent3: The conundrum about why the chicken crossed the road always makes me chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The conundrum of the missing piece in the puzzle felt like searching for a needle in a haystack.
meanings.sent5: The conundrum of the talking riddle box fascinated the children at the party.
